reviews.review_msg: He's a good guy and cares about the class and students. Very interesting topics and he brought lecture guests that create a sense of dynamism.

I really enjoyed taking Professor Moen's class. His lectures made sense, and he just had a way of saying things that really clicked with me. Your grade depends a lot on your TA but he bumps grades up if he thinks they graded too harshly. Your grade is mainly dependent on the midterm and final, the rest is participation and one activity + write up.

this class becomes the easiest class ever once you get used to his lecture style. he tends to get off topic, but his rants are usually very entertaining. the test questions are all short/long answer, but imo, thats the easiest way to snatch high marks. his slides are lacking in detail, but if youre interested in the topics, youll do just fine

Despite the lack of organisation and cohesiveness in his lectures, I actually had fun listening. You can tell he has a lot of passion in his work and he has a lot to say. It is kind of hard to get notes, but it is possible. While most of his grades are judged by exams and are graded by harsh TAs, he will gladly bump you up.

He doesn't explain any definitions of terms even though it's a 100-level course and his slides are too packed with information. He used many acronyms without explaining what they were, and his speech was quite different from his slide, which confused me. In general, the content wasn't really hard but profs made it a lot harder.

Alex is a great guy, however, the way he taught the course was not great. I did not find his lectures, slides, or readings useful as they were unclear and outdated, hard to read and understand. Course description might sound interesting, but don't take it unless you have to. Shout out to Richard , he's a great TA, really helpful

exams are based on incoherent readings from the 60s, and his lecture slides, which are supposed to guide you through the readings, are just as bad. They contain very little info with abbreviations no one understands. He's also kinda problematic IMO, saying social justice is “not as important as [we] think it is”?? Shoutout to TAs doing overtime lol
I was a student at NFS. He's not a bad guy, and he's clearly intelligent and cares a lot about his students and class. He's a bit eccentric and interesting, tolerable and almost enjoyable overall.

Was a NFS student and Moens is great. Amazing professor to talk to and is always willing to listen to the students. There's a lot of readings for the NFS and it's a intense program with long days, but its well worth it since Moens is always there to help out.

Professor Moens was a good professor and I enjoyed his lectures and tutorials. My biggest critiques would be the final exam because the questions didn't relate as well to content learned compared to the midterm questions. This made my mark drop from an A- to a B- .... Additionally, the marking for tutorials seemed harsher than most classes.

NATO FS 2019 Student, Prof. Moens differs from many fellow Poli Sci/IS profs in his unique world views and personal values, well respected and has some great connections, would recommend to future students to take the NATO FS if it is still available.

He is really great and genuinely engaging to listen to. We had a few guest lecturers to enhance the lessons and the grading organization is totally fair and manageable. Literally just memorize the key points in the lecture notes and readings and some history details for the tests.
Super passionate prof. Can be a tough marker on the quizzes but otherwise very fair.

good lecturer and i found that everything he said in class was easy to remember but i had trouble keeping up with which topic we were on. quizzes not too hard but you can't get a 10 simply by answering the Qs, need to add at least 4 points relating to the rest of the course. made us read a whole book in 2 days, but tests are all on lectures.

NATO Field School was awesome. Brushed shoulders with diplomats and got real world experience. A bit intensive but worth it. Prof was passionate and wanted students to succeed. Lectures are easy to keep up to. Appreciates participation.

This a prof who goes the extra mile for his students. Very knowledgeable, really helps to expand your critical thinking skills. Lectures are easy to keep up with, engaging public speaking voice and fair assignments.

Amazing lecture pace/passion, like a preacher of international relations. Best in poli sci at SFU. Deep knowledge of security, NATO, US foreign policy. Always goes out of his way for students, cares about engagement and gives students unparalleled access to his professional contacts.  Very respectful of all views, wants his students to succeed

His lectures were sort of scattered all over the place; one day we'd talk about economics and politics, next day the rise of China, then again economics and politics again. My notes had large gaps. His tests were fairly easy. World Order is an interesting read but everything you need to know is in lecture. Pretty easy class but dry at times

The worst class I have had to take. Read his pro Bush book and only register if you can stomach it. Exposing yourself to different points of views is healthy but going to a lecture and ending up in Sunday school is really painful. His article on Christian Realism (assigned reading) would make the Tea Party blush.

Intelligent, fair and helpful professor who takes an interest in his students. Classes are challenging for some if you don't have background in the course but if you make an effort you will shine bright at the end.

This prof enjoys class discussion and grades are reflective of this. Most importantly, stay on top of readings as most test questions are based out of that. The prof is friendly and willing to help if you ask.

A professor of political science who doesn't slant to the far left like so many others. Center-minded guy, with a lot of respect and tolerance to ideas from both sides of the political spectrum. Respectful, informative, and a clear communicator. Taken US-focused courses with him and he's not at all a US-hating ideologue like many others. Very fair.

Pretty decent professor. He is rightwing which was somewhat refreshing, but the first class he explained his views and stated you could agree or disagree as long as you had proof. He didn't ask for a great deal of writing and his tests were hard but fair. Be sure to attend lecture as he goes into more detail than what's simply on the lecture slides

Super nice guy, less than great prof. The class was easy, and required little work or effort beyond doing readings and showing up. Some readings were interesting, others few people bothered with. Class discussion didn't really ever move out of newspaper editorial territory. Hard to get an A, but a really easy B and probably impossible to fail.

I took American Political Science with Moens and I have to say that for a right-wing prof, Moens was pretty tolerant with other peoples opinions. He encouraged questions and discussion. Attending class is a must as he gives more info than on pp slides. Midterm and final were very hard, also keep up on current events, it will be your saving grace

Not sure if I have the class # right, but I was in his US politics class. He was not only well informed, knowledgeable, and clear in his teaching, but also tolerant of ALL political ideologies. As a political science student, I'm used to having very left-wing professors, Moens was fair to all sides of the spectrum which is a very rare trait in my experience.

Took both American Politics and American Foreign Policy with Moens. Can honestly say the hardest I had to work in my undergraduate degree, I mean that in a good way. Won't massage your academic ego with low work load. Stimulating discussion with a professor who, while right-leaning, grades based on your ability to defend an argument.

Prof. Moens is a heavily biased professor, who, in essence, teaches according to press releases from the US State department. Heavily US/right wing bias in regards to US politics, US press, and so on. There is nothing wrong with these views, but one expects more from a prof. Skip his class and tune in to Rush Limbaugh instead.

One of the most amazing profs I have ever had. He may have right-wing/Bush bias, but he respects other opinions, and he truly will mark according to the strength of your argument. Hard marking, but I learned a lot. Class applauded at the last lecture, never saw that happen for anyone before. Also quite friendly, encourages questions.

Professor Moens treats his student with utmost respect which is often not the case with other profs. His marking is a little on the hard side but is always available for extra help. pol 445 was very informative and classes were structured around an informal discussion setting which i found very refreshing. SFU needs more like him!
Was a distance course.  A bit more challenging than others I have done but worth it.  I learned a lot about the American political system.

I really don't know where this guy gets half of his irrational ideas but I want my money back.  This course was taught with a huge right-wing bias and does little to justify his claims.  He treated us like we were naive and failed to acknowledge our ideas.  A waste of my money, I could have just watched Fox News
He's one of the worst profs I've ever had at SFU.  Unless you are taking a requirement of sorts, I suggest you find yourself another class

This professor has a certain right-wing point of view, which might be viewed as a counter balance to SFU's left-wing political science department, however, he is not open to other opinions or views for that matter.  Spit out what he likes or watch your grade fall.
This guy rocks.  He has his views but as long as you give him a good argument he's open to it.  I would definitely take another course with him again.

Certainly further to the right than most of the faculty at SFU, but he is more thoughtful and respectful about his views than the majority of students and staff. His stance compels students who disagree with him to be able to clearly express and be consistent in their own beliefs, which is more valuable than simply hering what one might like to.

good prof. perfect flawless hair and appearance. during final, came in and said he decided to give us one hour instead of two which was unfair. fair marker. you really have to know your current events. interested in peoples race background but not ****.
No Comments

The only reason I took US Politics was because it's the only course I could get into. But I'm glad now that I did. Moens is amazing and I love his teaching style. I agree that not everyone may like him, but he suits me and I can't wait to take another class with him :D

Moens is right wing, true, but you can tell his bias and at least move around it.  He teaches the class very well, gives good readings, and really did give me a much better grasp of US politics - the exact thing i wanted to get from the class.  I recommend him for his clarity and his teaching ability, not for his frustratingly conservative views.
Great prof. Challenging, interesting, smart. Allows for difference in opinions, well spoken... highly recommended.
Great professor. Extremely clear, allowing students to be given a variety of points of view on all topics. He is an outstanding professor, who goes out of his way to help you.
very good

Moens is an excellent teacher. He goes slow in lectures so you are not scrambling to write and repeats if necessary. He keeps the lectures extremely interesting and is one of the best pol teachers ive had.  I would suggest his calss to everyone!

Can you say blinded by the ideology? Being a self-proclaimed neocon and advocate of Bush is one thing, but framing an entire class in terms of Bush and why he's right is a little off. Not to mention that he himself seems ignorant of the intellectual roots of neoconservatism; perhaps because they're his roots as well...

He's a great guy.  Not the easiest marker but you get alot out of his class.  He's a bit right wing for my taste, don't go buck wild defending your liberal viewpoints unless you have some great arguments.

Great class, but lots of reading. Moens is fair and fun.  Students need to hear a conservative point of view once and a while, and at least be held to account for their untested liberal perspectives.  Lowest grade on first paper in class was a B.

Course stems from current "power politics", not an academic analysis of US politics. Excessive reading, assignments were fair. Lotsa Questions in Exams, minimum time. Exams, assignments, and course content  extremely bias.
Excellent speaker, very intelligent, chooses words carefully and is thoughtful, although certainly biased in favor of Bush. Great class altogether

Recieved A+ & A- respectively without doing all the readings.  Took his classes through Dist Ed.  Not too hard for the amount of work...no tut, no lec, and no exams. only papers. Pretty interesting as well.

For a Neo-Conservative I suppose he's an alright guy. Besides the horrendous bias he brings with him, he makes some interesting points. I found the lectures very one-sided though. He believes in what he says and is ready for a debate, but make sure you've read "his book."
interesting, arguments well supported- hwr, assignment Q's are way too biased (topic wise).

Moens is a great guy, he's very intelligent and well-informed, and he gives very thoughtful and engaging lectures. He's open with his beliefs until the majority of SFU professors who try to pretend they don't have a bias. He really engages the class in discussion, and is always ready to debate. A+!
Materials were interesting, and paper topics were fresh.  As far as the teaching aspect though, leaves much to be desired, and be careful going against Bush or his buddy God.

Alex is great. He's very interested in politics, and it is evident in his lectures. He has a Bush fetish that is a bit disturbing, but if you can get over it than you should be alright. Tip: write your final paper on anything agreeing with Bush's policies and you will get an A. Class is great.

Amazing. His lectures are informative, interesting , and well prepared.  His lectures have a right-leaning bias, and will offend those on the 'hard-left' who refuse to approach his class with an open mind. Amazingly skilled, knowledgable and tactical in debates. All combined, he's an amazing prof.
Wonderful class. This professor brings the OTHER side to all this left wing hippy junk that is just shovel fed to Canadians. I hope people in his class listened, because you can LEARN A LOT!

Took his online course.  I've heard he's ok in person, but online its "submit right wing **** or fail".  Was unbelievably unresponsive to questions.  Everyone stopped participating and just dialed in the kind of garbage he writes for the Vancouver Sun. Sorta makes me sick they pay him.
Polemicists should not invade academia.
Defending George Bush?  Sorry, if I was interested in this stuff I would just watch fox news. Awfull.

Awesome lecturer. Doesn't waste one word. Concise, to the point, informative, conservative, yet shows variety of prespectives. It takes balls to defend the Iraq war against the overwhelming effidence, but Moens makes a case. Smart dude...should run against Harper, I'd vote for him.
He's a good prof.  Reasonable assignments and a fair marker.  His class on the EU is dreadfully boring, but everything else i've had him for has been excellent.
fantastic prof. clear, concise lectures (a rarity) and feedback. conservative, yes - but not offensive. he gives them a good name.
A course on George W. Bush from a Republican-oriented professor. Interesting debates in class. Very enjoyable!
Right-wing but interesting.  Good, clear lecturer.  Have taken both distance ed and in-class and both were straight-forward.  Distance ed 232 is a breeze and super informative.  Biases are clear.
Yay a Christian professor, with an open mind!
Great guy alot of work, but his views are refreshing.
Excellent prof. Even though he has strong opinions he is open to all other opinions. Very relevant lectures. He is a nice guy!

Moens is a researcher and writer, not a teacher. However, he tries hard and makes up for his weakness in teaching by giving great advice on essays. He marks fairly and treats students with respect.  He does have strong opinions!
finally, a rightwing prof!!!!!!!!  i hate him b/c he is an ass, but yay rightwing
close minded! don't disagree with him. his conservative family values are extreme.
helpful, good feedback given on work
Politically very conservative, but allows for good class discussions
No Comments
it was distance ed, but the material was clear and easy to follow, easy marking
Not bad.  Just don't ever say  Chomsky  in class.
No Comments
Terrific Lectures (genuinely interesting), very approachable and knowlegable
No Comments
Be prepared for his classes. If you are you're golden.
No Comments
